intro: Protea pallens, commonly known as the silver protea, is a striking South African plant belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescence composed of numerous white to pinkish flowers arranged in a spherical or conical shape. The plant is native to the Western and Eastern Cape provinces of South Africa, where it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Protea pallens is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
